 My point is that Beck's vommitings are inconsistent. He claims:
 1. Obama is a socialist
 2. Obama is against white culture
 
 Given that modern socialism has its origin in the industrial revolution in countries that have overwhelmingly white populations there are two explanations. First is that Beck is ignorant of the origins, as well as the ideals, of socialism (most likely, and my first thought). Second is that Beck believes in the Nazi myth that socialism and communism are results of a Jewish conspiracy, and hence not of "white" origin at all (this is less likely, but once you get that far right, you start hating every difference, and anti-semitism is usually a big part of that. This is less true in the US than in other countries, because hating Muslims is more fashionable and it's easier to hate Muslims if you can claim to be defending the Jewish state). How would you explain the known facts?

You would do better with some facts to back up your claim. Not to mention when you resort to your usual insults you have already lost the argument. 

 
Earlier this week, Glenn Beck helped Katie Couric kick off her new web series @KatieCouric, which features candid interviews with political, business, and entertainment newsmakers.
 
 In the interview, Glenn Beck was asked to clarify his July 28th statements in which he called President Obama a "racist" and claimed Obama had a "deep-seated hatred for white people or the white culture." When pressed by Couric to define "white culture," Beck refused to answer. 
 
 "Go to GlennBeck.com, listen to it, you can hear all of it," Beck responded.
 
 When Couric brought up the question again, suggesting that Beck should be able to back up his statements, the popular Fox News host said, "I don't know how to answer that that's not a trap." 

 Glenn Beck refuses to define 'white culture' in Katie Couric interview (Video)
